text.section:
A claim for refund may be filed with the tax collector who collects the tax, fee, or charge by a claimant who:
erroneously pays to the State a greater amount of tax, fee, charge, interest, or penalty than is properly and legally payable;
pays to the State a tax, fee, charge, interest, or penalty that is erroneously, illegally, or wrongfully assessed or collected in any manner; or
pays a tax qualifying for refund under subsections (b) through (h) of this section.

A claim for refund of alcoholic beverage tax may be filed by a claimant who:
buys alcoholic beverages that are exempt under § 5-104(b) of this article;
discontinues an alcoholic beverage business;
discontinues the sale and delivery in the State of alcoholic beverages in certain container sizes; or
holds alcoholic beverages for sale that:
are condemned by an authorized official; or
if the claim is $250 or more, are lost, rendered unmarketable, or destroyed in the State due to fire, flood, or other disaster, or due to vandalism or malicious mischief, except loss due to theft.

section.section: A claim for refund of income tax may be filed by a claimant whose Maryland taxable income is decreased as a result of a federal contract renegotiation under § 1481 of the Internal Revenue Code.

A claim for refund of income tax under this subsection or subsection (a) of this section may be filed:
by the claimant; or
on behalf of the claimant, by a person allowed to file a return under § 10-808 of this article.

text.section:
A claim for refund of Maryland estate tax or Maryland generation-skipping transfer tax may be filed by a claimant required to pay the tax if:
the Maryland estate tax is decreased as a result of:
a decrease in the federal estate tax on the estate; or
an inheritance tax payment made after a Maryland estate tax payment; or
the Maryland generation-skipping transfer tax is decreased as a result of a decrease in the federal generation-skipping transfer tax on the generation-skipping transfer.

A claim for refund of motor carrier tax may be filed by a claimant who has excess motor carrier tax credit, if:
the claimant has provided the security required for a motor carrier under § 13-825 of this title; or
the Comptroller has audited the records of the claimant.
